newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesia palm olein stable in late trade.
newsitem.headline: Indonesia palm olein stable in late trade.

text.p: Indonesian palm olein prices were generally stable in late trading on Tuesday, with a lack of fresh leads keeping a lid on demand, traders said.

They said palm olein was quoted at 1,395-1,400 rupiah/kg in Jakarta, unchanged from the opening, but offers were also heard at 1,390 rupiah. Crude palm oil was done at 1,231 rupiah/kg at a tender in the North Sumatran city of Medan on Monday.
"Trading was sluggish in the absence of fresh news," one trader said. "Buyers are only taking what they need immediately, preferring instead to wait for developments."
Traders said they expected local palm olein prices to hover around the current level through the week, but added that there was pressure from players with ample stocks.
"One player with 2,000 tonnes of imported RBD palm oil is selling below the market range," one trader said.
Data from Belawan Port showed that the MT Kraton will leave the North Sumatran port on Tuesday with 2,000 tonnes of palm olein for Semarang.
